intro: Patabea tenerior, commonly known as the slender patabea, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a smooth, glossy surface. Patabea tenerior is often found in humid, shaded environments within the understory of tropical forests.
